FSG have said Nothing all Summer - apart from issue a pathetic apology to Southampton. They need to squash this now and issue a statement ending the Coutinho speculation.

But if Coutinho is sold then it shows their true colours. Revenue over success on the pitch. Coutinho is on a 5-year contract. We DO NOT have to sell. Don't give the player or Barcelona a hint that he could be sold. That just shows weakness and lack of ambition. I cannot believe we may cave in, even if £120m is on offer. RB Leipzig stood firm and told us to do one. Southampton are standing firm on VVD (yes I do expect him to go - but Southampton ARE a feeder club). And Arsenal without Champions League football are standing strong over Sanchez, despite him only having one-year left on his contract.

Klopp wanted to turn us from doubters to believers. Keep Coutinho and I will keep the faith, but if he is sold then my belief in FSG will be gone.
